title: My Schools and Schoolmasters; Or, The Story of My Education
author: Miller, Hugh
snippet: I formed my first imperfect acquaintance with the recent ganoidal fishesin 1836, from a perusal of the late Dr. Hibbert's paper on the depositof Burdiehouse, which I owed to the kindness of Mr. George Anderson.

title: The Importance of Being Seven
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Many years later, with Wee Fraser now fifteen or thereabouts, Dr Fairbairn had met him on a bus to Burdiehouse; Wee Fraser,

title: Tweed and Don; or, Recollections and reflections of an angler for the last fifty years ...
author: Locke, James.
snippet: Continuing our way through Buccleuch Pend, and along by the Meadows and the Sciennes, we pass the Grange Toll, the Pow Burn, and on to Burdiehouse by the Windmill and St Cathe- rines.
